intro: Spiesia hypsophila, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy species suitable for rocky or alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in its native habitat.
